name: pncan3oi
body: |- wceq(co(co(c0, caddc, c1), cmin, c1), c0)

stmt.origin: mp2an(wceq(co(co(c0, caddc, c1), cmin, c1), c0), wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc))

body.origin:
|- wceq(co(co(c0, caddc, c1), cmin, c1), c0)
-| wcel(c0, cc)
-| wcel(c1, cc)
-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wceq(co(co(c0, caddc, c1), cmin, c1), c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(co(co(c0, caddc, c1), cmin, c1), c0)
-| wcel(c0, cc)
-| wcel(c1, cc)
-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wceq(co(co(c0, caddc, c1), cmin, c1), c0))

body.origin: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wceq(co(co(c0, caddc, c1), cmin, c1), c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wceq(co(co(c0, caddc, c1), cmin, c1), c0)
-| wcel(c0, cc)

comment: Subtraction and addition of equals. Almost but not exactly the same as ~ pncan3i and ~ pncan , this order happens often when applying "operations to both sides" so create a theorem specifically for it. A deduction version of this is available as ~ pncand . (Contributed by David A. Wheeler, 11-Oct-2018.)
